channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Sony lists PC version of Uncharted 4 in investor report
item.description: Listed under “more PC releases planned” amid strong returns for Horizon’s port.

item.title: Scientists induced hallucinations in mice to learn more about human psychosis
item.description: Study uncovered a surprising link between how human and mouse minds malfunction

item.title: Windows 10 21H1 available now, improves document load times
item.description: The changes in 21H1 are mostly minor—much bigger things are coming in October.

item.title: These offline, disc-based games require an online check-in on Xbox Series X
item.description: One-time connection required for configuration on Xbox One and Smart Delivery discs.

item.title: No, it doesn’t just crash Safari. Apple has yet to fix exploitable flaw
item.description: WebKit bug that was fixed upstream has yet to find its way into Apple products.

item.title: Arm’s Cortex X2-based CPUs are 30 percent faster and more efficient
item.description: Arm is also floating a laptop chip design with eight Cortex X2 cores.

item.title: Russia tried to spread dangerous lies about Pfizer vaccine, France suspects
item.description: French officials likened the lies to campaigns run by Russia’s Internet Research Agency.

item.title: Apple TV 4K gets 8 out of 10 repairability score in iFixit’s latest teardown
item.description: The Apple TV 4K itself is surprisingly easy to service. Its remote? Not so much.

item.title: JJ Abrams: Lack of plan in Star Wars’ latest trilogy was a “critical” flaw
item.description: Hindsight is 20/20: “There’s nothing more important than knowing where you’re going.”

item.title: Falcon 9 completes its 100th successful flight in a row [Updated]
item.description: The company has rarely used such a “young” rocket for a Starlink mission.

item.title: Amazon to buy MGM for $8 billion in major boost to Prime Video library
item.description: Amazon announces purchase, promises “greater access” to historic studio’s films.

item.title: Dutch court orders Shell oil company to cut carbon emissions 45% by 2030
item.description: The energy giant plans to go carbon-neutral—but not quickly enough for the court.

item.title: EU suspects Facebook of abusing power with Marketplace, report says
item.description: Company allegedly pushed Marketplace to undermine rival classified ad sites.

item.title: The 2021 BMW M3: When you’re driving it, you don’t have to see its nose
item.description: The new M3 proves to be more than just an aesthetic punchline.

item.title: Knockout City is the best team-deathmatch game we’ve played in years
item.description: Step one: Replace guns with dodgeballs. Steps two through 27: Tweak for madcap fun.

item.title: New USB-C Type 2.1 standard offers up to 240 W power delivery
item.description: 240 W power delivery over USB-C lets high-powered laptops lose the barrel jack.

item.title: Moderna’s data in kids ages 12-17 “consistent with a vaccine efficacy of 100%”
item.description: The company plans to seek FDA authorization in early June.

item.title: Amazon’s most-favored nation clauses slammed in lawsuit filed by Washington, DC
item.description: DC AG: “Amazon fixed online retail prices through contract provisions and policies.”

item.title: Vulnerability in VMware product has severity rating of 9.8 out of 10
item.description: Remote code execution flaw in vCenter Server poses “serious” risk to data centers.

item.title: Today’s best tech deals: Nintendo Switch games, Logitech mice, and more
item.description: Dealmaster also has deals on phone mounts, USB-C hubs, and gaming monitors.

item.title: Exclusive: Valve is making a Switch-like portable gaming PC
item.description: We can confirm some, but not all, of what’s in store for the codenamed “SteamPal.”

item.title: Florida makes it illegal for Facebook and Twitter to ban politicians
item.description: Leaders compare Big Tech to “communist rule,” will issue $250,000 per-day fines.

item.title: 24-inch M1 iMac teardown finds… not that much inside, actually
item.description: It’s basically a MacBook Air with a large screen and a small cooling system.

item.title: Google launches its third major operating system, Fuchsia
item.description: The Google Nest Hub is the world’s first commercial Fuchsia device.

item.title: Sensor-driven turbine platforms could unlock 4,000 TWh of offshore wind
item.description: Bringing the biggest turbines to deep waters is an engineering challenge.

item.title: Hyundai reveals US specs for Ioniq 5 electric crossover
item.description: Retro-futuristic styling, 18-minute charge times, and a range of 300 miles.

item.title: Unsolved Mysteries: Quantum Leap’s Don Bellisario on the fate of Sam Beckett
item.description: The man who came up with Sam, Al, and Ziggy dishes on the show—and what happened next.

item.title: COVID cases after vaccination are still very rare—variants aren’t changing that
item.description: Numbers are an undercount, but they offer more data that vaccines are highly effective.

item.title: It’s ransomware, or maybe a disk wiper, and it’s striking targets in Israel
item.description: Dubbed Apostle, never-before-seen wiper masquerades as ransomware.

item.title: Bernie Sanders wants to stop NASA funding for Blue Origin
item.description: The Endless Frontier Act? More like the Endless Amendment Act.

item.title: Freenode IRC staff resign en masse after takeover by Korea’s “crown prince”
item.description: Former staffer alleges “a hostile entity is now in control… and has your data.”

item.title: Actively exploited macOS 0-day let hackers take screenshots of infected Macs
item.description: Apple patches vulnerability that malware used to bypass macOS privacy protections.

item.title: For research citations, no replication is no problem
item.description: Looking back at big replication projects, finding they don’t seem to have mattered.

item.title: Efficacy of Chinese vaccines is “not high”—officials back 3rd dose
item.description: Protection wanes by 6 months; experts call for high-risk people to get 3rd dose.

item.title: The Epic v. Apple case could hinge on the definition of the “marketplace”
item.description: Has Apple unfairly locked down iOS? Or is it boxed in by external competitors?

item.title: iOS 14.6 and macOS Big Sur 11.4 arrive with new audio features and more
item.description: One of the biggest features won’t become available until June, though.

item.title: We have our first good look at Eternals as Marvel drops extended teaser
item.description: “Throughout the years we have never interfered… until now.”

item.title: Biden cuts broadband plan from $100 billion to $65 billion to match GOP offer
item.description: Biden makes $65B offer, but GOP opposes municipal broadband and overall jobs plan.

item.title: From trash to jet fuel in 60 minutes—and 220º C
item.description: Researchers found a way to make fuel from plastic—critics wonder if it’s practical.

item.title: iFixit tells the sad story of how Samsung “ruined” its upcycling program
item.description: iFixit was Samsung’s upcycling partner in 2017 but says Samsung never delivered.

item.title: China will likely ban all bitcoin mining soon
item.description: Country’s top financial regulator homes in on the source.

item.title: Ford reveals pricing for the F-150 Lightning Pro work truck
item.description: The 300-mile extended-range version will cost $49,974 before tax incentives.

item.title: YouTube feels heat as Russia ramps up “digital sovereignty” drive
item.description: Google faces fallout as Moscow moves to force Western tech groups to comply with laws.

item.title: After Virgin Galactic’s success on Saturday, how soon can it fly again?
item.description: “We will immediately begin processing the data.”

item.title: Eternally five years away? No, batteries are improving under your nose
item.description: Under the hood, lithium-ion batteries have gotten better in the last decade.

item.title: Review: Zombie heist thriller Army of the Dead is Zack Snyder at his best
item.description: Snyder reined in his worst impulses in this entertaining twist on a zombie apocalypse.

item.title: Google’s I/O Adventure was almost as good as being there
item.description: Holding a trade show inside an online game is actually pretty fun.

item.title: When is a Porsche 911 not a Porsche 911? When it’s a Ruf
item.description: The cars have starred in Gran Turismo and on the Nordschleife.

item.title: All those electric vehicles pose a problem for building roads
item.description: Gas taxes are the largest source of funding for highway construction, maintenance.

item.title: Hear ye, DarkSide! This honorable ransomware court is now in session
item.description: Colonial Pipeline hackers have cashed in spectacularly. Now, they’re feeling the heat.

item.title: IMF says $50 billion is needed to end Covid pandemic in 2022
item.description: Nations with sufficient supply could donate doses to vaccinate 60% of world population.

item.title: The Atlantic hurricane season’s first storm forms early—again
item.description: Ana’s formation is part of a trend toward earlier storms in the Atlantic.

item.title: This AI makes Robert De Niro perform lines in flawless German
item.description: Technology related to deepfakes helps match facial movements to dialogue.

item.title: A zombie-fire outbreak may be growing in the north
item.description: “Overwintering” fires smolder under the snow, reigniting vegetation in the spring.
